citation.article-title: Holospora (ex Hafkine 1890) nom. rev., a genus of bacteria inhabiting the nuclei of paramecia.

p.s: Description of Holospora undulata (ex Hafkine 1890) nom. rev., emend.
Holospora undulata (un.du.la'ta. L. adj. undulatus undulated, with waves.)
Cells develop in the micronuclei of P. caudatum.
Vegetative cells are spindle shaped and are up to 3 μm long.
Infectious cells are sinuous filaments about 16 μm long and have tapered ends.
The type is the original description and illustration of Hafkine (8).

Clone Ml-48 of P. caudatum containing H. undulata in its micronuclei has been deposited in the culture collection of the Laboratory of Invertebrate Zoology, Biological Research Institute, Leningrad University.
